Package JourneyPlanner

Class Station

  • java.lang.Object
    • JourneyPlanner.Station
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RoutingStation
    public class Station
extends java.lang.Object
    A Station object acts as a node in the graph
    Author:
    Michael Wade

    • Constructor Detail

      • Station

        public Station​(java.lang.String name,
               java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> adjacentStations)
        Creates a new Station object
        Parameters:
        name - the unique name of the station (uniqueness is not checked)
        adjacentStations - A hashtable of the adjacent stations in the graph. Keys are the station names, values are the stations

      • Station

    • Method Detail

      • adjacentStations

        public java.lang.String[] adjacentStations()
        Returns an array of the names of the stations which are adjacent to this station
        Returns:
        array of adjacent station names

      • isAdjacentTo

        public boolean isAdjacentTo​(Station other)
        Check if this station is adjacent to the given station
        Parameters:
        other - the station is check
        Returns:
        true, if other is adjacent to this, returns false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if other is null

      • addAdjacentStation

        boolean addAdjacentStation​(Station station)
        Set a station as being adjacent to this one. Note that addAdjacentStation is automatically also called on the parameter station to add the calling station to its list of adjacent stations. That is S.addAdjacentStation(T) also calls T.addAdjacentStation(S).
        Parameters:
        station - the station to add as adjacent. Not null.
        Returns:
        true, if the station was added. false, if the stations are already adjacent
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if station is null

      • removeAdjacentStation

        boolean removeAdjacentStation​(java.lang.String stationName)
        Remove a station from being adjacent to this one. This can be used to remove a railway track from the graph so that it is avoided during routing. Note that S.removeAdjacentStation(T) also calls T.removeAdjacentStation(S). So this method essentially removes the edge ST from the graph.
        Parameters:
        stationName - the adjacent station to remove. Not null.
        Returns:
        true, if the station was removed. false, if the stations aren't adjacent
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stationName is null

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Get the (unique) name of this station
        Returns:
        the name of this station

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this station: name, [adjacent station1, adjacent station2, ...]
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation
